If the rectangle was a rectangular room in your home and the square was a square room in your home and you were going to carpet the room with the least area at a cost of 5.75 dollars per square foot, how much would you spend on buying the carpet (Round to 2 digits)

solution.p: The perimeter and area of a rectangle are given by
The perimeter and area of a square are given by
The circumference and area of a circle are given by
To find the total bill for the carpet, use the smallest area between the rectangle and square and multiply that area by the cost per square unit of carpeting.

A box with a square base and no top is to be made from a square piece of carboard by cutting 5 in. squares from each corner and folding up the sides. The box is to hold 10580 \text{in}^3. How big a piece of cardboard is needed?
Your answer is: in. by in.

Note: Your answer must be a number or a decimal. It may not contain any arithmetic operations.
The volume of the cube is \text{cm}^3.
